metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4333 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
The HDF5 1.8.16 library allocating space for the array using a value fromthe file has an impact within the loop for initializing said array allowinga value within the file to modify the loop's terminator. Due to this, anaggressor can cause the loop's index to point outside the bounds of thearray when initializing it.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4333` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

hdf5-helpers - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-1~exp5
hdf5-tools - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-1~exp5
libhdf5-100 - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-1~exp5
libhdf5-cpp-100 - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-1~exp5
libhdf5-java - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-1~exp5
libhdf5-jni - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-1~exp5
libhdf5-mpich-100 - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-1~exp5
libhdf5-openmpi-100 - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-1~exp5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: hdf5 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.0-patch1+docs-1~exp5').
